title: Identification of Nanogram Amounts of Certain Organochlorine Insecticides
journal: Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry
authors: Kaufman, W.M. and Bills, D.D. and Hannan, E.J.
location: Department of Food Science and Technology, Oregon State University, Corvallis, Oregon 97331, United States
abstract: Individual insecticides, eluting from a gas chromatographic column, were detected with an electrón-capture detector and concurrently trapped in a Teflon capillary tube. Fifty microliters of solvent was added, and the trapped component was irradiated with ultraviolet (uv) light. Following irradiation periods of 15 to 120 sec, the contents of the Teflon tube were reinjected into the gas chromatograph and the uv-induced degradation pattern was noted. Characteristic “fingerprint” degradation patterns were obtained for nanogram quantities of heptachlor, heptachlor epoxide, aldrin, dieldrin, and the p,p′ and o,p′ isomers of DDT, DDE, and DDD. Analysis of a number of foods, soil, and osprey egg demonstrated the utility of the method to aid in the identification of the above insecticides in actual samples, even in the presence of coextracted materials or artifacts. The latter, which have retention times identical to those of certain insecticides, do not give the characteristic “fingerprint” degradation pattern of the insecticide upon irradiation. © 1972, American Chemical Society. All rights reserved.

title: Side-chain cleavage of cholesterol to C6 and C8compounds by adrenal and testis tissue preparations
journal: Biochimica et Biophysica Acta (BBA)/Lipids and Lipid Metabolism
authors: Burstein, S. and Zamoscianyk, H. and Co, N. and Adelson, M. and Prasad, D.S.M. and Greenberg, A. and Gut, M.
location: ["Division of Steroid Chemistry, Institute for Muscle Disease, New York, NY 10021, United States", "The Worcester Foundation for Experimental Biology, Shrewsbury, MA 01545, United States"]
abstract: 1. 1. Using gas-liquid chromatography the conversion of [25,26-3H2]cholesterol to isocaproaldehyde, isohexanol, isocaproic acid, 2-methylheptan-6-one and 2-methylheptan-6-ol has been studied with adrenal and testis preparations without the addition of "trapping" agents. 2. 2. With bovine adrenocortical mitochondrial soluble preparations, isocaproaldehyde, isohexanol and isocaproic acid were formed. In some of the bovine, preparations either isocaproaldehyde or isohexanol predominated, but in none was the isocaproic acid a major product. 3. 3. With human and chicken adrenal acetone-dried powders isohexanol was observed as the major product along with smaller amounts of isocaproaldehyde and isocaproic acid. 4. 4. [4,5-3H2] Isocaproaldehyde, of the same specific activity as the [25,26-3H2]-cholesterol used, was rapidly converted to isohexanol and isocaproic acid with a bovine acetone-dried powder preparation and to isohexanol with a human adrenal preparation, strongly indicating that isocaproaldehyde was the primary product of the cholesterol side-chain cleavage. These studies appear to be the first demonstration of the existence of an isocaproaldehyde reductase system in adrenal preparations. 5. 5. With a soluble bovine acetone-dried preparation in which cholesterol was converted predominantly to isocaproaldehyde and in which pregnenolone was not significantly further converted to other products, a 1:1 stoichiometric relationship was observed between this C21 steroid and the sum of the C6 compounds formed. A similar 1:1 stoichiometry was also observed with two human adrenal acetone-dried powders, in which the further metabolism of pregnenolone was insignificant. 6. 6. No 2-methylheptan-6-one or 2-methylheptan-6-ol was formed with a human adrenal mitochondrial acetone-dried powder preparation obtained from a patient with an androgen-secreting adrenal carcinoma. 7. 7. Incubation of rat testis and adrenal homogenates with [25,26-3H2]cholesterol after the procedure of Jungmann (Biochim. Biophys. Acta, 164 (1968) 110) yielded isocaproic acid as the only positively identifiable volatile product. The carrier C8 compounds 2-methylheptan-6-ol and 2-methylheptan-6-one added at the end of the incubation were isolated either devoid of radioactivity or containing insignificant counts as compared to the isocaproic acid. The mean maximal possible combined radioactivity in these two C8 compounds was 1 500 and 1 4000 of that found in the isocaproic acid obtained with testis and adrenal homogenates, respectively. This contrasted with the studies by Jungmann7 who reported ratios of 1 2.4 and 1 15.4 for 2-methylheptan-6-one, with these two tissues, respectively.

title: POULTRY PRODUCT QUALITY. 2. Storage Time‐Temperature Effects on Carbonyl Composition of Cooked Turkey and Chicken Skin Fractions
authors: DIMICK, P.S. and NEIL, J.H.M.
location: Division of Food Science and Industry, Pennsylvania State University, University Park, Pennsylvania, 16802, United States
abstract: SUMMARY: The carbonyl compounds in cooked turkey and chicken skin fractions after storage were isolated as their 2,4‐dinitrophenylhdrazones. The monocarbonyl class was separated into methyl ketones, 2‐enals and 2,4‐dienals and measured spectrophotometrically. The turkey skin residue fraction contained higher concentrations of carbonyls than did the chicken samples. The oil extract from the skin of both groups was similar in carbonyl concentration. Lower storage temperature dramatically lowered the development of carbonyls. Phospholipid phosphorus determinations indicated the residue contained high levels of polar lipid; whereas, negligible amounts were in the oil. Thin‐layer chromatography of the carbonyl classes from the skin residue indicated mainly C7‐C9 2‐enals and C8, C9 2, 4‐dienals in the unsaturated aldehyde fractions. Changes in fatty acid composition of the residue polar lipids during storage suggested linoleic and arachidonic acids as the probable substrates in autoxidative deterioration. title: Topographische Darstellung der Kerngebiete der Medulla oblongata des Huhnes (Gallus domesticus)
authors: Goller, H.
location: Institut Für Tieranatomie, Universität Bern, Switzerland
abstract: Makroskopisch lassen sich an der etwa 1 cm langen Medulla oblongata des Huhnes der kaudale, zum Rohr geschlossene und der nasale, die Fossa rhomboidea bergende Teil unterscheiden. Die neencephalen Bildungen des Stammhirns wie der Pons, das Corpus trapezoideum und die Pyramis sowie Vorwölbungen an der Oberfläche durch darunterliegende Kerngebiete sind nicht zu finden. Mikroskopisch zeichnen sich an der Struktur der Querschnitte im kaudalen Teil die allmählichen Umformungen von den Zellsäulen des Rückenmarkes zu isoliert liegenden Kernen und eine zunehmende Durchflechtung von grauer und weißer Substanz in kaudo‐nasaler Richtung ab. Im nasalen Teil wird im Zentrum ungefähr die Hälfte der Querschnittsfläche von dem als Nucleus reticularis bezeichneten Koordinationszentrum eingenommen. Um dieses herum gruppieren sich je nach Schnitthöhe die Kerne der Gehirnnerven, der Strangsysteme und der Olive in unterschiedlicher Form und Größe. Topographical demonstration of nuclei in the medulla oblongata of the fowl (Gallus domesticus) In the medulla of the fowl, about 1 cm. in length, it is possible to distinguish macroscopically a caudal part forming a tube, and a nasal part bearing the Fossa rhomboidea. One cannot recognise the neencephalic structures of the cerebral trunk, such as the pons, trapezoid body and the pyramids, or the surface convolutions produced by underlying nuclei. Microscopically, the caudal part in cross‐section shows gradual transformations of cell columns of the spinal medulla to form isolated nuclei and also an increasing intermingling of the grey and white matter in the caudonasal direction. In the nasal part, at about its centre, half the cross‐section comprises the coordination centre known as the reticular nucleus. Around this nucleus there are grouped, according to the situation, the nuclei of the cranial nerves, the funicular systems and the olives in differing form and dimensions. Représentation topographique des régions nucléaires de la moelle allongée de la poule (Gallus domesticus) Macroscopiquement, on distingue sur la moelle allongée de la poule, longue d'un centimètre environ, une partie caudale, accolée à la moelle, et une partie nasale, cachant les fosses rhomboïdes. On ne trouve pas de formations néencéphales du cerveau, telles que le pont, le corps trapézoïde et la pyramide, ni de voussures superficielles dues à des régions nucléaires sous‐jacentes. Microscopiquement, on distingue sur la surface des coupes transversales de la partie caudale des transformations graduelles, depuis les piliers cellulaires de la moelle épinière jusqu'aux noyaux placés isolément, et un entrelacement croissant de substance grise et blanche en direction caudo‐nasale. Dans la partie nasale, environ la moitié de la section transversale dans le centre est occupée par le centre de coordination désigné comme noyau réticulaire. Autour de lui se trouvent groupés, selon la hauteur de la coupe, les noyaux des nerfs cervicaux, du systeme cordonal et de l'olive, de formes et de dimensions différentes. En la medula oblongada de la gallina, de 1 cm aprox. de largo, se distinguen, desde el punto de vista macroscópico, la parte caudal, cerrada hacia el conducto, y la nasal, que alberga la fosa romboidea. No se hallan las formaciones neencefálicas del tronco cerebral, tales como el puente, el cuerpo trapezoide y la pirámide, así como tampoco las prominencias en la superficie mediante zonas nucleares situadas debajo. Microscópicamente se advierten en la estructura de los cortes transversales, en la parte caudal, las transformaciones graduales de las columnas celulares de la medula espinal en núcleos situados de forma aislada y un trenzado creciente de las substancias gris y blanca en la dirección caudonasal. En la parte nasal, en el centro aproximadamente, ocupa la mitad de la superficie transversal el centro coordinador denominado núcleo reticular. Alrededor de éste se agrupan, según la altura de sección, los núcleos de los nervios cerebrales, de los sistemas funiculares y de la oliva en formas y tamaños desiguales. © 1969 Blackwell Verlag GmbH

title: Hetero-Corneal Transplantation in Experimental Animals
authors: Paul, S.D.
location: The M.U. Institute of Ophthalmology and the Gandhi Eye Hospital, Aligarh, UP, India
abstract: In this investiga tion the author compared the results of hetero-keratoplasty of 3 weeks and 22 months' duration. Techniques employed were of the lamellar, the interlamellar epithelialized and the interlamellar de-epithelia lized grafts. The percentage of clear gra fts after 3 weeks' observa tion in the interlamellar de-epithelia lized grafts of chicken to rabbits was 70%. 11 months' obsenation in the epithelialized interlamellar graft of chicken to rabhil fell from 66% to 6.2% and 22 months to zero. In the de-epithelialized group, 11 months' observation period indicated a fall from 70% to 25%, which remained static after 22 months. © 1964 S. Karger AG, Basel.
